page.title: 06VISIT TO U. S. P. C. A.
page.content: I went on a visit to our local U. S. P. C. A. shelter. The inspector told me about an owl caught in a field in a wire trap. The inspector came and dazzled it with a torch. He found that the owl had a claw broken off. After treatment at the shelter the owl was later returned to the wild. The first bird the inspector treated at this shelter was a young peregrine falcon. I was allowed to see the dogs at present being kept at the shelter. There were about ten dogs. Some of them had been abandoned by their owners. The inspector pointed out that many people like puppies but abandon them when they grow up. I enjoyed my visit but I did not like to see the dogs people neglected.
